summary: This document appears to be a financial statement from J.P. Morgan, detailing procedures for addressing errors or questions regarding account transactions. It outlines the responsibilities of the account holder and the bank in case of discrepancies, as well as information about margin accounts and securities transactions.
locations: Three Chase Metrotech Center, Brooklyn, NY 11245-001
keyFacts: The document provides instructions for reporting errors on financial statements within 60 days.
It specifies the need for account holders to describe errors and provide dollar amounts for suspected discrepancies.
The document mentions that J.P. Morgan Clearing Corp. holds positions in margin accounts.
It outlines the bank's obligations to investigate complaints and correct errors promptly.
The document is marked as confidential under federal rules.
